intro: Uragoga schumanniana, commonly known as the Schumann's uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, clustered fruits. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
